content: a basic pattern using the magic loop technique with one circular needle the pattern has been designed to be used in a basic sock-knitting class but videos of the techniques used are available on youtube socks can be knit a whole lot of different ways this sock will be knit top down which means you start at the cuff above the ankle and work down and around the heel along the foot and finish with the toe it will have a slip_stitch heel a heel flap and a gusset a standard toe finished with kitchener stitch aka grafting this basic pattern can be made in any size using these techniques and just altering the thickness of yarn the needle size and the number of stitches and rounds two sizes given medium/female large/male for around 18 5cm 22cm foot circumference 100gm 4ply/sock yarn with 350-400m in total 2 5mm needles 100cm circular needle for magic loop removable stitch markers 2 regular stitch markers a wool needle a 2mm or 2 5mm crochet hook preferably a straight metal or bamboo one and not one which has a thick handle scissors pattern and pencil to mark the pattern gauge/gauge this can vary with knitter yarn and pattern average for sock-knitting is around 8-9sts/10cm on 2 5mm needles work out for yourself your gauge over time remembering lacy patterns have more give than cables and asymmetric ones 1 co = cast on us bind on pu = pick up cast off us bind off sm = slip marker from one needle to the next k = knit k2tog = knit 2 stitches together decrease p = purl ssk = slip slip knit this means slip two st or sts =stitch or stitches stitches individually as if to knit then knit the sl = slip a stitch slipped stitches together through the back wyb = with yarn behind loops decrease alternative psso= slip one wyf = with yarn in front knit one pass slip_stitch over decrease st st = stocking stitch p2tog = purl 2 stitches together decrease rib = alternating knit and purl stitches in a * generally signifies the beginning of a row/round repeated stitch pattern first a diagram to show the structure of a sock 2 cuff cast on 64 72 sts loosely divide these evenly between the 2 needle ends of the circular needle and join in the round being careful not to twist the stitches mark the start of the round with a removable stitch marker you are now going to knit in rounds not row which means the right side is always facing and you keep going around rounds 1-12 k2 p2 rib all around leg knit all rounds until the sock is between 16 and 20cm from the cast on edge you can also add a simple stitch pattern which divides evenly into the number of sts for example a 4 6 or 8 st repeat for the medium size or a 4 6 9 or 12st repeat
